pages.text:
Downtown Winter Garden Events
Weekly, holiday, and annual flagship events make Downtown the place to be!
From year-round weekly events such as Fridays on the Plaza live music outdoor concert and Saturday’s Winter Garden Farmers Market, to annual events such as Martin Luther King Jr. Community Celebration, Winter Garden Music Festival, Spring Fever in the Garden, Winter Garden Halloween Experience, Shop Small Business Saturday, Light Up Winter Garden, Winter Garden Christmas Parade, and Holiday Market as well as additional month-long ‘Tis the Season events — there is always something happening Downtown!
September 2024
Sep
3
Art Exhibition: “¡Viva El Arte!”
Tuesday, September 3
7:30 am - 5:30 pm
Curated by the Winter Garden Art Association, this exhibit features various forms of 2-D and 3-D artistic expressions from Central Florida Hispanic Artists. These colorful works of art are sure to brighten your day! Free.
Art in Public Places Gallery in City Hall, 300 W Plant Street
Sep
3
Central Florida Railroad Museum – It’s About Time: How The Railroads Created Our Time Zones
Tuesday, September 3
11:00 am - 3:00 pm
The four time zones of the United States were created in 1883 by the railroads to standardize schedules and improve safety. This exhibit looks at how the railroads influence the way we schedule our lives, and the tools we use to keep us "on time".
Central Florida Railroad Museum, 101 S. Boyd Street
Sep
3
Winter Garden Heritage Museum: “Seminole Attire: History and Culture through Design”
Tuesday, September 3
11:00 am - 3:00 pm
The style of clothing displayed here originated in the 1920s and continues to develop today with its trademark, intricate patchwork designs.
Winter Garden Heritage Museum, 1 N. Main Street
Sep
3
One Last Roar: A History of the Winter Garden Lions Club
Tuesday, September 3
11:00 am - 3:00 pm
The Winter Garden chapter of the Lions Club disbanded in April 2023 but left an indelible legacy of service to the region. This exhibit will document and showcase the history of this group of people whose dedication to the gift of sight led to fundraising efforts that helped thousands of people. Artifacts, medals, banners, photographs, and much more will grace the Winter Garden Heritage Museum to honor this vital organization. Free Admission.
Winter Garden Heritage Museum, 1 N. Main Street

Winter Garden Art Association SOBO Art Gallery & Studio, 127 S. Boyd Street

SOBO Art Gallery: Pinwheels for Peace ~ Create a Free Pinwheel & Plant It!
Saturday, September 21
9:00 am - 12:00 pm
All ages welcome to design a pinwheel and include a message of peace on its stake and plant it on the SOBO Art Gallery lawn for display in celebration of International Peace Day. All materials provided complimentary.  Please allow 40 minutes to complete. All children must be accompanied by an adult. Click image to reserve a pinwheel. Free.

Art Exhibit: “Orlando Urban Sketchers”
Thursday, January 2
7:30 am - 5:30 pm
Curated by the Winter Garden Art Association, this unique exhibit showcases the work of the Orlando Urban Sketchers, a group of artists dedicated to capturing the world around them, one sketch at a time. Featuring scenes from everyday life in and around Central Florida, these works highlight the beauty of urban environments through ink, watercolor, and pencil. Stop by City Hall to experience this unique visual journal of our community.
Winter Garden City Hall, 300 W. Plant Street

Winter Garden Heritage Museum Exhibit: “Champions of West Orange County: A Legacy of Athletic Excellence”
Thursday, January 2
11:00 am - 3:00 pm

This exhibit invites sports enthusiasts of all ages to connect with the spirit of competition, resilience, and community pride. Free admission.

2
Winter Garden Heritage Museum: “From House Calls to Hospitals: Caring for West Orange County”, sponsored by Orlando Health
Thursday, January 2
11:00 am - 3:00 pm
The exhibit traces the evolution of healthcare from the days when doctors drove horse-drawn wagons to their patients' homes, to today's state-of-the-art medical facilities. Related professions such as nursing and dentistry are also honored. Free Admission.

Thursday, January 2
11:00 am - 3:00 pm

3
Art Exhibit: “Orlando Urban Sketchers”
Friday, January 3
7:30 am - 5:30 pm
Curated by the Winter Garden Art Association, this unique exhibit showcases the work of the Orlando Urban Sketchers, a group of artists dedicated to capturing the world around them, one sketch at a time. Featuring scenes from everyday life in and around Central Florida, these works highlight the beauty of urban environments through ink, watercolor, and pencil. Stop by City Hall to experience this unique visual journal of our community.
Winter Garden City Hall, 300 W. Plant Street
Jan
3
Art Exhibition: “It’s a Wonderful Life in Winter Garden”
Friday, January 3
7:30 am - 5:30 pm
This exhibition tells the visual story and written narrative of contemporary life in Downtown Winter Garden through the lenses of 10 experienced Crealdé master class students. Black & White photographs highlight Winter Garden's history, its diverse community of residents and business owners, and unique way of connecting historic preservation, economic development, and overall quality of life.
Art in Public Places Gallery in City Hall, 300 W. Plant Street

Central Florida Railroad Museum: Railroad Depots of Central Florida Exhibit
Tuesday, October 7
11:00 am - 3:00 pm
Railroads arrived in Orange County in 1880, and their steel rails quickly spread throughout the region. Goods and passengers arrived and departed at dozens of Central Florida depots, allowing for convenient connections to and from points north and south. This photo exhibition features depots long departed and some that remain in use today.

“All is Calm: the Christmas Truce of 1914” at the Garden Theatre on Plant, presented by the Winter Garden Heritage Foundation featuring Opera Orlando
Saturday, December 20
7:30 pm - 9:00 pm
This nonfiction story tells the moving story of the 1914 Christmas Truce during World War I. Out of the violence, a silence, then a song. A German soldier steps into No Man’s Land singing “Stille Nacht.” Thus begins an extraordinary night of camaraderie, music, peace, sharing a message of peace and humanity amidst the conflict. 21
Winter Garden Music Festival
Saturday, February 21
11:00 am - 10:00 pm
Hosted by the City of Winter Garden, this annual, multi-stage event turns historic downtown into an open-air concert venue with 30+ musical performances throughout 11 hours. A vast variety of music genres are represented including pop, country, rock & roll, blues, rhythm and blues, reggae, jazz, Latin, soul, top 40, and more!  The event includes a Kids’ Zone with children’s activities as well as onsite vendors for food, beer, and wine. Stay tuned to cwgdn.com and downtownwg.com for more information.

Downtown Winter Garden Events
Weekly, holiday, and annual flagship events make Downtown the place to be!
From year-round weekly events such as Fridays on the Plaza live music outdoor concert and Saturday’s Winter Garden Farmers Market, to annual events such as Martin Luther King Jr. Community Celebration, Winter Garden Music Festival, Spring Fever in the Garden, Winter Garden Halloween Experience, Shop Small Business Saturday, Light Up Winter Garden, Winter Garden Christmas Parade, and Holiday Market as well as additional month-long ‘Tis the Season events — there is always something happening Downtown!
September 2024
Sep
3
Art Exhibition: “¡Viva El Arte!”
Tuesday, September 3
7:30 am - 5:30 pm
Curated by the Winter Garden Art Association, this exhibit features various forms of 2-D and 3-D artistic expressions from Central Florida Hispanic Artists. These colorful works of art are sure to brighten your day! Free.
Art in Public Places Gallery in City Hall, 300 W Plant Street
Sep
3
Central Florida Railroad Museum – It’s About Time: How The Railroads Created Our Time Zones
Tuesday, September 3
11:00 am - 3:00 pm
The four time zones of the United States were created in 1883 by the railroads to standardize schedules and improve safety. This exhibit looks at how the railroads influence the way we schedule our lives, and the tools we use to keep us "on time".
Central Florida Railroad Museum, 101 S. Boyd Street
Sep
3
Winter Garden Heritage Museum: “Seminole Attire: History and Culture through Design”
Tuesday, September 3
11:00 am - 3:00 pm
The style of clothing displayed here originated in the 1920s and continues to develop today with its trademark, intricate patchwork designs.
Winter Garden Heritage Museum, 1 N. Main Street
Sep
3
One Last Roar: A History of the Winter Garden Lions Club
Tuesday, September 3
11:00 am - 3:00 pm
The Winter Garden chapter of the Lions Club disbanded in April 2023 but left an indelible legacy of service to the region. This exhibit will document and showcase the history of this group of people whose dedication to the gift of sight led to fundraising efforts that helped thousands of people. Artifacts, medals, banners, photographs, and much more will grace the Winter Garden Heritage Museum to honor this vital organization. Free Admission.
Winter Garden Heritage Museum, 1 N. Main Street

Art Exhibition: “It’s a Wonderful Life in Winter Garden”
Friday, November 1
7:30 am - 5:30 pm
This exhibition tells the visual story and written narrative of contemporary life in Downtown Winter Garden through the lenses of 10 experienced Crealdé master class students. Black & White photographs highlight Winter Garden's history, its diverse community of residents and business owners, and unique way of connecting historic preservation, economic development, and overall quality of life.
Art in Public Places Gallery in City Hall, 300 W. Plant Street
Nov
1
Central Florida Railroad Museum – It’s About Time: How The Railroads Created Our Time Zones
Friday, November 1
11:00 am - 3:00 pm
The four time zones of the United States were created in 1883 by the railroads to standardize schedules and improve safety. This exhibit looks at how the railroads influence the way we schedule our lives, and the tools we use to keep us "on time".
Central Florida Railroad Museum, 101 S. Boyd Street

1
Winter Garden Heritage Museum: “Seminole Attire: History and Culture through Design”

Winter Garden Heritage Museum, 1 N. Main Street

30
Central Florida Railroad Museum – It’s About Time: How The Railroads Created Our Time Zones
Thursday, January 30
11:00 am - 3:00 pm
The four time zones of the United States were created in 1883 by the railroads to standardize schedules and improve safety. This exhibit looks at how the railroads influence the way we schedule our lives, and the tools we use to keep us "on time".
Central Florida Railroad Museum, 101 S. Boyd Street

24
Central Florida Railroad Museum: Railroad Depots of Central Florida Exhibit
Saturday, January 24
10:00 am - 3:00 pm
Railroads arrived in Orange County in 1880, and their steel rails quickly spread throughout the region. Goods and passengers arrived and departed at dozens of Central Florida depots, allowing for convenient connections to and from points north and south. This photo exhibition features depots long departed and some that remain in use today.
Central Florida Railroad Museum, 101 S. Boyd Street

26
Art Exhibit: “Creative Spirit of Winter Garden”
Monday, January 26
7:30 am - 5:30 pm
Discover the vibrant artistry flourishing within our community on display. Curated by the Winter Garden Art Association, the exhibit features work by local artists who live and create in Winter Garden, offering a unique opportunity to explore their stories, inspirations, and creative processes. From vivid landscapes to expressive abstracts, each piece reflects the rich cultural fabric and imaginative energy of our city. Come celebrate the artists who shape the creative spirit of Winter Garden.
Winter Garden City Hall, 300 W. Plant Street

11:00 am - 10:00 pm
Hosted by the City of Winter Garden, this annual, multi-stage event turns historic downtown into an open-air concert venue with 30+ musical performances throughout 11 hours. A vast variety of music genres are represented including pop, country, rock & roll, blues, rhythm and blues, reggae, jazz, Latin, soul, top 40, and more!  The event includes a Kids’ Zone with children’s activities as well as onsite vendors for food, beer, and wine. Stay tuned to cwgdn.com and downtownwg.com for more information.
Historic Downtown
Feb
23
Art Exhibit: “Creative Spirit of Winter Garden”
Monday, February 23
7:30 am - 5:30 pm
Discover the vibrant artistry flourishing within our community on display. Curated by the Winter Garden Art Association, the exhibit features work by local artists who live and create in Winter Garden, offering a unique opportunity to explore their stories, inspirations, and creative processes. From vivid landscapes to expressive abstracts, each piece reflects the rich cultural fabric and imaginative energy of our city. Come celebrate the artists who shape the creative spirit of Winter Garden.
Winter Garden City Hall, 300 W. Plant Street

Feb
24
Central Florida Railroad Museum: Railroad Depots of Central Florida Exhibit
Tuesday, February 24
11:00 am - 3:00 pm
Railroads arrived in Orange County in 1880, and their steel rails quickly spread throughout the region. Goods and passengers arrived and departed at dozens of Central Florida depots, allowing for convenient connections to and from points north and south. This photo exhibition features depots long departed and some that remain in use today.
Central Florida Railroad Museum, 101 S. Boyd Street
